TopicTitle: Is my computer good for KSP?

Articles.Content: I've been using my computer to play KSP for a long time, but after reading a computer support forum post, I really thought that maybe my computer ISN'T good for playing KSP. After all, the other people are using over-the-top gaming PC's capable of doing billions of calculations per second, while I just have a levono T430s Thinkpad. Do I really have a good computer for KSP, or is it only good for web browsing?
And if we say no you stop playing the game because it will be no fun any more?
It's fine, just keep in mind that too many parts on a vessel will bog it down, also too many mods

Well, looking at the specs on Google; it's not terrible besides the 4 Gb of RAM.

You say it plays KSP, so yeah; it's a good computer to run KSP in my opinion.

I used to play KSP on an old laptop that wasn't much better, and I enjoyed it just as much then on the lowest settings at 20fps as I do now on a better computer with highest settings and 60fps.

Edited November 11, 2017 by Rocket In My Pocket
Don't install visual mods.  KER is probably fine though.
